trial_identification.studytitle: An investigation into the effect of Physiotherapy services in Emergency Departments on patient wait, and treatment times.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: physiotherapy management of patients attending emergency departments and its effect on patient wait times

conditions.healthcondition: Back Pain presenting to emergency departments
Lower limb injuries presenting to emergency departments
upper limb injuries presenting to emergency departments
mobility issues presenting to emergency departments

interventions.interventions:
Physiotherapy assessment of patients involving standard musculoskeletal assessment of patients. This involves performing a general history of presenting complaint with the patient and physical assessment of the injured body part including active, passive, resisted movements, ligament and muscle tests and mobility assessment.
Physiotherapy management will involve the treatment deemed appropriate to the patient by the assessing physiotherapist. This may include provision of mobiilty aids, education, plastering and splinting, provision of home exercises and referral for further services.
The patient will be seen on one occasion only over the 6 month period. The duration of assessment and management is expected to vary depending upon the condition presenting and will range from 30 minutes to 2 hours
interventions.comparator: Historical data collected on patients seen prior to inception of physiotherapy emergency service over the period of July 1 to Nov 30th 2007. This data will be taken from medical records of pateints who were seen by physiotherapy over this period.

primaryOutcome.outcome: patient wait time to see physiotherapist, recorde in minutes
primaryOutcome.timepoint: time recorded at triage and at first contact with physiotherapist

secondaryOutcome.outcome: patient time spent in emergency department
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: time calculatied from triage unitl patient discharged home or admitted to ward

secondaryOutcome.outcome: type of condition pateints are seen for
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: recorded upon physiotherapist examinatino of patient

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All patients attending the emergency department at concord repatriation general hospital meeting triage category 3, 4 and 5, with musculoskeltal or mobility related issues

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Physiotherapy Department Concord Repatriation General Hospital hospital Road Concord NSW 2139

ethicsAndSummary.summary: to determine appropriate patients that can be managed by ohysiotherapists in the emergency department and assess the effect on patient waiting times to be treated and have treatment completed when presenting to the emergency department with musculoskeletal or mobility related issue.
